importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the Hamas-led attack on Israel that resulted in the death of Sergeant Major Tal Haimi, marking the beginning of the ongoing conflict and hostage crisis.
The signing of the US-proposed Gaza ceasefire deal, which set a timeline for the return of deceased hostages and became a focal point of diplomatic and military tension.

The date of the identification and return of Sergeant Major Tal Haimi’s remains, signifying progress in the implementation of the ceasefire agreement and public sentiment surrounding deceased hostages.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The deadline set by the ceasefire agreement for Hamas to return all deceased hostages, which has been repeatedly delayed and is now a key point of contention.

keyTakeAways: Sergeant Major Tal Haimi, a 41-year-old Israeli soldier, was killed on October 7, 2023, while defending a kibbutz during the Hamas-led attack.
His body was identified by Israeli forensics examiners and returned to Israel on October 20, 2025, as the 13th deceased hostage to be transferred under the ceasefire agreement.
Haimi is survived by his wife, four children, father, and sister, and his family received condolence messages from the Hostages and Missing Families Forum.

The ceasefire agreement requires Hamas to return all deceased hostages within the first 72 hours, but Israeli intelligence assesses Hamas may not be able to locate all bodies due to war damage and destruction in Gaza.
One of the bodies previously handed over by Hamas did not belong to an Israeli hostage, suggesting possible misidentification rather than intentional deception.
Hamas has stated that significant efforts and equipment are needed to recover bodies in Gaza due to extensive destruction.
Diplomatic efforts continue between Israel, Hamas, and the United States, with US President Donald Trump threatening to 'eradicate' Hamas if it violates the ceasefire.
US officials including Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner held meetings with senior Israeli military officials to discuss ceasefire implementation and recovery of hostages.
Israel’s leadership, including Knesset Speaker Amir Ohana, insists the ceasefire agreement—particularly the return of deceased hostages—must be fulfilled regardless of obstacles.

namedEntities.name: Sergeant Major Tal Haimi
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An Israeli military officer and deceased hostage
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the central figure whose remains were identified and returned, symbolizing both personal loss and progress toward fulfilling the ceasefire agreement’s terms.

namedEntities.name: Hamas
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Palestinian militant group responsible for the October 7, 2023 attack
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hamas is the entity responsible for holding hostages and is required under the ceasefire deal to return deceased Israeli hostages, which has become a point of negotiation and tension.

namedEntities.name: Israel Defense Forces (IDF)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The IDF played a key role in confirming Haimi's identity, managing the return of bodies, and demanding Hamas fulfill its obligations under the ceasefire.

namedEntities.name: United States
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The US government, particularly under President Donald Trump
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The US brokered the ceasefire deal and now acts as a mediator, with Trump threatening military action against Hamas if the agreement is violated.

namedEntities.name: Donald Trump
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He publicly threatened to 'eradicate' Hamas if it violates the ceasefire, signaling strong US political and military pressure on Hamas.

namedEntities.name: Steve Witkoff
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: US special envoy to the Gaza ceasefire efforts
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He held meetings with Israeli military leaders to discuss ceasefire implementation and the return of hostages, showing active diplomatic engagement.

namedEntities.name: Jared Kushner
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Trump’s son-in-law and key political figure in ceasefire negotiations
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He participated in high-level meetings with Israeli military officials, indicating close US-Israel coordination in enforcing the ceasefire.

namedEntities.name: Amir Ohana
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He publicly affirmed that the return of deceased hostages must be fulfilled, showing domestic political commitment to the ceasefire agreement.

namedEntities.name: Thai national Sonthaya Oakkharasri
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Serves as a context marker for the sequence of identifications, showing the ongoing process of returning and confirming deceased hostages.

namedEntities.name: Red Cross
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Red Cross retrieved the body from Gaza and facilitated its transfer to Israeli authorities, playing a key logistical role in the recovery process.

namedEntities.name: Knesset
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Knesset represents Israel’s legislative body, with its speaker advocating for the enforcement of ceasefire commitments.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Sergeant Major Tal Haimi, a 41-year-old Israeli soldier killed on October 7, 2023, during a Hamas-led attack, has been identified and returned to Israel as the 13th deceased hostage under the US-proposed Gaza ceasefire agreement. His body, recovered by the Red Cross and transferred to Israeli forces, was confirmed through forensic examination. The return comes amid ongoing diplomatic efforts between Israel, Hamas, and the United States to enforce the ceasefire, with Hamas facing criticism for delays and possible misidentifications in returning bodies. Israeli officials stress that the return of all deceased hostages—within the original 72-hour deadline—must be fulfilled, even as Hamas claims significant challenges due to wartime destruction. The US, led by President Donald Trump and envoys Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, maintains firm pressure on Hamas, threatening military action if the agreement is violated. This development reflects both the personal tragedies of families like Haimi’s and the broader geopolitical tensions shaping the ceasefire’s viability.
title: Israel Identifies Body of Deceased Hostage as Sergeant Major Tal Haimi
